title: Reward distribution will fail when there are backlisted users.
validator comment: incomplete effort, addresses in distribution list are trusted

title: a user can stake rsr just before a reset vote against any reset
validator comment: incomplete effort, no concrete scenario, pretty sure it's invalid

title: Function manageTokens can be front-runned, causing user calls to fail
validator comment: incomplete effort, and manageTokens() is correct to not be called twice when trade is ongoing

validator comment: low effort, does not understand FixLib

title: fallback lacking payable
validator comment: facade is out of scope

title: no access control on `_authorizeUpgrade`
validator comment: access control is in function body

title: Using length of array in loop
validator comment: low effort, just describes minor gas waste

title: Protocol does not implement protection against upgradeable ERC-20s
validator comment: tokens that protocol interacts with are trusted, also no specific poc in the finding

title: Users are unable to bump their nonce
validator comment: user can sign and use a signature with the same nonce to invalidate signatures

title: OwnerSteptransferOwnership instead of OwnertransferOwnership
validator comment: low effort

title: Incorrect return values for ERC20 functions.

title: rToken can avoid paying any fees by setting DAOFeeRegistry to a different contract
validator comment: this is intended, RToken owners are able to decide whether to sign up for veRSR. The important thing, which the warden acknowledges, is that DAOFeeRegistry can't be changed once it is set.

title: wrong check in basketlib.sol
validator comment: I don't understand what the warden is saying, to my understanding this check is fine. Based on mitigation, there is a misunderstanding. If totalWeights <= goodWeights, no backup collateral is needed

title: Lack of Access Control in AssetRegistryP1 Contract ::swapRegistered(IAsset asset)
validator comment: there IS a "governance" modifier

title: No check for sequencer uptime can lead to dutch auctions executing at bad prices
validator comment: DutchTrades settle at no less than worstPrice which by definition is a price that still makes sense. Internally Reserve has discussed that this lack of a sequencer check is fine but I believe this wasn't known for this contest. On the basis of that, there is still some risk of less than ideal settlement. Finding as such is satisfactory based on this.

title: Stake rate can be updated by functions that should not update it
validator comment: pointing to invalid comments, no evidence there is an issue

title: `RevenueTrader` can sell unpriced assets for near zero value
validator comment: no evidence for an issue, i.e. lack in poc

validator comment: melt() is called in AssetRegistry.refresh() since RTokenAsset is assumed to be registered, see comments in AssetRegistry

title: MinTradeVolume is subtracted more times than it should
validator comment: no evidence for any impact, i.e. recollateralization is so complex that more evidence is needed

title: Governance can bypass DAO fee through custom EasyAuction implementation
validator comment: satisfactory report, interesting way to opt out of DAO fee payment

title: Unable to start the gnosis auction

title: BaskedHandler.sol init will revert when upgrading contract
validator comment: this is fine, issuance premium will just start as disabled after the upgrade, after all it is optional

title: issue() 's availability will be impacted due to incorrect conditional in issuancePremium()

title: StRSR era changes can be leveraged for governance attacks
validator comment: report is satisfactory, not sure if it should result in valid finding though because unstable governance during era changes was discussed in previous C4 reports / marked as systemic risk in Trust Sec reports. title: Users can dodge losses due to StRSR era changes with instant operations
validator comment: report is satisfactory, not sure if it should result in valid finding though because unstable governance during era changes was discussed in previous C4 reports / marked as systemic risk in Trust Sec reports. validator comment: describes lack of sequencer as in other findings but report quality is too bad, no real scenario provided

validator comment: warden submitted issue twice (see the above validation-21 finding)

title: Misallocation of reserved space, which will lead to a storage collision when updating the contracts concerned.
validator comment: there is a mistake in that defining an array of length 50 only uses storage slots 0 to 49, not 0 to 50. Beyond that the report is low quality and doesn't prove the issue.

validator comment: refresh() being publicly accessible is intended and correct

title: Haircut is never reached

validator comment: the claim that a IFFY asset is selected over a SOUND asset is wrong, the warden did not understand the isBetterSurplus() function correctly

title: Incorrect Validation of `portions` Sum May Lead to Incorrect Redemptions (`RTokenP1::redeemCustom`)
validator comment: the function works as intended, the warden claims there is a distinction between "fixed point arithmetic" and "uint256 arithmetic" which there is not

title: Unchecked Return Value in ERC20 Approve Function
validator comment: the return value doesn't need to be checked because the approved amount is checked. If safeApproveFallbackToMax() doesn't set the intended amount, the function will revert.

title: Integer Division Rounding in `forwardRevenue` Function Can Lead to Loss of Tokens (`BackingManager::forwardRevenue`)

title: Reward accounting functions still vulnerable to bypassing, leading to unintended reward distribution

title: `payoutRewards` function can be called directly in the stRSR possibly altering the normal behavior of the protocol.
validator comment: there is no impact to calling payoutRewards() before someone else, warden claims variable values get messed up without providing evidence

title: The throttle may be incorrectly updated when dissolving or melting rTokens
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid

title: Attacker can manipulate auction outcome by exploiting rounding in clearingPrice calculation (`GnosisTrade::settle`)

title: Systemic Vulnerability Due to Rigid Asset Dependency in AssetRegistry

title: Inconsistent State Handling in `BasketHandlerP1::refreshBasket()` Can Lead to Permanent Basket Disablement
validator comment: The claim by the warden is wrong: "The basket is now in a disabled state, but lastStatus doesn't reflect this.". trackStatus() at the end of refreshBasket() sets lastStatus = DISABLED: https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-07-reserve/blob/3f133997e186465f4904553b0f8e86ecb7bbacbf/contracts/p1/BasketHandler.sol#L168

validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid

title: `price` in the `BasketHandler` could be major than the FIX_MAX
validator comment: high > FIX_MAX is downsized in below line: https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-07-reserve/blob/3f133997e186465f4904553b0f8e86ecb7bbacbf/contracts/p1/BasketHandler.sol#L457

title: The fee in Gnosis trading isn't included in the calculation of the minBuyAmount
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid, I have a memory that the auction fee is assumed to be included in the worstCasePrice calculation

title: slippage loss to user during rToken redemption
validator comment: I have validated other slippage findings, but this one doesn't understand the mechanics, redeem() function is only available in fully collateralized state, i.e. when rebalancing is not ongoing.

title: Attacker can `unstake` and ` cancelUnstake` in the same timestamp manipulating some variables in `StRSR`
validator comment: finding does not show any evidence how state can be manipulated and cause harm to other users

title: DOS stakeAndDelegate function due to not to write _checkpoints during minting
validator comment: minting stRSR writes a checkpoint: https://github.com/code-423n4/2024-07-reserve/blob/3f133997e186465f4904553b0f8e86ecb7bbacbf/contracts/p1/StRSRVotes.sol#L201-L204, finding does not provide sufficient evidence that claims are correct

title: underflow on ``quote``, when the decimal token is 6 and the rounding is FLOOR
validator comment: low effort report, there is no description in terms of impact, links are to p0 implementation

title: Zero Distribution Vulnerability in Revenue Distribution Logic
validator comment: division by totalShares is only executed if it's not zero, finding is invalid

title: The traceEnd in BackingManager isn't updating correctly
validator comment: sufficient quality report, I think usually not an issue because auctions are very short and don't take as long as in the report. That said, the variable dutch auction length is a valid concern

title: MEV strategy on `stRSR::seizeRSR` without subject to staking risk during rebalances
validator comment: the finding is invalid because a rsr seizure does not allow to unstake more rsr

title: Attacker can exploit custom redemption to receive more value than intended (`RTokenP0::redeemCustom`)
validator comment: Known issue (TRST-M-1): https://github.com/reserve-protocol/protocol/blob/1c961c93c0452e770d124559e9a4cdcb7e9e0c6d/audits/Trust%20Security%20-%20Reserve%20Audit%20Report%203_2_0.pdf There are mitigations in place, the remaining attack surface is accepted. I believe the finding by the warden is sufficiently similar to the known issue to not be accepted as valid.

title: Malicious proposals can be executed in the Governance
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid

title: Seizure-triggered era reset will wipe out significant user holdings (`StRSRP1::seizeRSR`)
validator comment: this is a design decision, the warden doesn't provide any evidence of an issue

title: Incorrect baskets can be created when swapping registered assets
validator comment: issue requires same erc20s with different target names which would be governance self-rekt, hence invalid

title: It is impossible to use `cancel` in a meaningful context
validator comment: Governance contract works as expected, malicious proposals are cancelled by the guardian in the TimelockController

title: issue and redeem can be called in the same timestamp allowing an attacker to manipulate some state variables
validator comment: low effort, making claims without any proof

title: The Loss of Fund of the protocol due to Incorrect Boundary Check of Loop
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid (probably not)

title: Users will be unable to redeem tokens when unregistered assets exist in old baskets (`RTokenP1::redeemCustom`)
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid

title: Volatile exchange rates cause slippage loss to users during issuance and rebalancing the collateral
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid, but indeed there might a need for slippage protection now due to issuance premium, however the report feels like the warden is mixing up concepts

title: The supply throttle checking in issuance should be performed after the `_scaleUp`.
validator comment: sufficient quality report, not sure if valid

title: Uneven token distribution in `RToken` redemption process
validator comment: low effort, warden shows a redemption that receives different amounts for different tokens but doesn't explain what exactly is wrong with that. Very likely it works fine and warden is misunderstanding it.

title: AssetPluginRegistry.sol
validator comment: low effort

title: Incorrect Handling of `amtBaskets` During Initial Issuance May Lead to State Inconsistencies (`RTokenP1::issueTo`)
validator comment: basketsNeeded is incremented in _scaleUp() so the claim in this report is wrong

title: Improper State Management in `rebalance()` Function Can Lead to Incorrect Trade State (`BackingManagerP1::rebalance`)
validator comment: tradesOpen is incremented and decremented in the Trading child contract, so there is no improper management of the variable

title: Incorrect Validation of `portions` Array Can Lead to Under-Collateralization (`RToken::redeemCustom`)
validator comment: the individual portions are not validated but the sum is validated to be 100% so there is no issue, portions can't be negative

validator comment: the buy and sell assets ARE defined and passed to the trade contracts, I think the warden doesn't understand solidity, the test is made to revert but there isn't any issue
